page.title: 04MONDAY IS MARKET DAY - 2
page.content: Lunchtime already. After a morning checking the animals I settle down to lunch again to be disturbed. This time it's a rep. "Sorry my husband is at market. I don't know what time he will be home, goodbye." Thank goodness for the automatic washing machine. I hang the washing on the line, start the housework and prepare dinner. My husband returns with a smile of content, the stock sold well. After dinner I take the tractor and trailer to collect bales from the hayfield and return to the rickyard. I water the plants in the greenhouse and pick the raspberries. The dogs are waiting to be fed, how pleased they are to see me. After a busy and enjoyable day it's 11.30pm and I am ready for my bed.
